author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students appearing for Plus Two examinations at Mambalampattu Government Higher Secondary School near here were in for a shock when they reached the examination hall on Friday as there were no invigilators.

The students who had reached the centre on time found that all the 17 teachers and invigilators who had been deputed for the centre were absent.

On information, Chief Educational Officer S. Mars, along with a flying squad, rushed to the venue. Zoology exam began after a delay of half-an-hour. The students were granted extra time.

An official in the Education Department said that the authorities had failed to inform the invigilators about the examination schedule on Friday. Alternative arrangements were made immediately and the students wrote the examination. The Department has sought an explanation from the officials concerned, he said. – Staff Reporter
title: All 17 invigilators absent at examination centre
